snippet: A horse trainer once known for his flashy ways has adopted a lower-key approach and is again a force on the sport’s biggest stages.
abstract: D Wayne Lukas, horse trainer once known for his flashy ways, has adopted a lower-key approach and is again a force on the sport’s biggest stages; victory by Oxbow in the Preakness was Lukas’s 14th in a Triple Crown race, moving him past Jim Fitzsimmons, the most successful trainer in American classic races; Lukas is preparing for the Belmont Stakes and hopes for another win.
lead_paragraph: A horse trainer once known for his flashy ways has adopted a lower-key approach and is again a force on the sport’s biggest stages.

headline.seo: For Trainer D. Wayne Lukas, Another Renaissance
headline.main: A Flashy Trainer Is Enjoying a Renaissance
headline.print_headline: A Flashy Trainer Is Enjoying a Renaissance
